Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen, I want to share with

you a great recipe for my Caprese Chicken,
this would be great on the outdoor grill,

we are battling the worst rain, it's like
every day that I want to share this recipe

with you outside on the grill, there's a rain
storm, so we're going to make it inside on

the skillet, which is going to come out absolutely
delicious if not even more delicious because

of all the sauce gets all yummy and gooey,
but I'll walk you through what you can do
if you make this on your outdoor grill.

Let's work on the chicken for now because
I'm just going to make a quick marinade for

it and give it lots of flavor, I've got some
chicken breast here, I don't know if you can

tell but I've sort of scored the top a little
bit, you don't want to go all the way through,

just a little bit and this kind of gives your
chicken a chance to really absorb the marinade.

The marinade is really simple, it's made out
of, not Dijon Mustard, you could use Dijon

mustard, I'm using whole grain mustard here,
I've got some all purpose everyday seasoning,

this is one by Rachael Ray, but you could
make your own.
Whatever you fancy.

Garlic, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt
and pepper, that's all you're going to need

and this is absolutely delicious on chicken
breast, chicken thighs, you know me, I love
my chicken thighs.

I've got chicken breast here today, and it
works perfecto.

Adding everything in here, the balsamic really
gives you some delicious sweetness, a little

bit of extra virgin olive oil, regular olive
oil is fine, some salt, some pepper, good

good good, this is going to give your chicken
really good flavor, now if you were doing

this on the grill, you would marinate the
chicken for a while, and then pop it right

onto the grill and you would take a small
skillet, like a cast iron skillet, and you

would place it onto the grill, directly to
let that preheat and then you would make the

sauce on the skillet on the grill and then
the chicken would get smoky from grilling
it alongside the skillet if that makes sense.

But, we're just going to do this indoors today,
and it's fine, these chicken breasts are quite

big as you can see, they're about ten ounces
a piece.
So one of them can feed two people, I think.

side dishes with it.
